page.title: 04Easington Colliery (cont)
page.content: On Tuesday May 29th 1951 there was a terrible explosion at Easington Colliery and 81 men were killed. Most of the dead are buried in the local cemetery. In the Welare Park, close by a tree was planted for every man who died. From March 1984 all the miners were on strike. The strike lasted for a year and caused great hardship for all the people in Easington Colliery. In June 1985 many families are just beginning to recover from the effects of the strike. Ian's dad is a miner at the colliery. He wrote "My dad gets up in the middle of the night to go to work. He often takes bread and jam to eat when he is at work down the pit. He is a face worker and he travels on an underground electric train to reach the coal face which is nearly seven miles out under the sea.
